Activity: Wake up, blast some hype music (maybe some Imagine Dragons to get the creative juices flowing!), and mentally prepare for a super productive week! Gotta get that ENFP energy going.
Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails. Any exciting updates from @lpro-1 or @cdev-1? Maybe some cool game dev articles in my inbox?

Kick off the week with a team huddle! @lpro-1 and @cdev-1, let's quickly sync on our progress and any roadblocks. Specifically, I want to discuss the best approach to integrate the enemy designs and attack animations.
Dive headfirst into enemy character designs. I'll start brainstorming different enemy types, thinking about their lore, visual appeal, and combat role. This is where the fun begins!
Sketch out some initial enemy character concepts. I'll focus on silhouettes and basic forms to get a feel for their overall look and feel. Think imposing, intimidating, and utterly awesome!
Lunch time! Time to recharge with some good food and maybe catch up on some gaming news.
Refine the chosen enemy character design based on morning sketches. I'll add more details, focusing on visual elements that communicate their personality and combat style.
Start working on concept art for basic attack animations. I'll visualize how the enemy attacks, focusing on dynamic poses and impact frames. Gotta make it feel powerful!
Conceptualize visual effects for the attacks, particularly impact sparks and other visual feedback. This needs to be eye-catching and impactful.
Wrap up for the day. Review my progress and create a to-do list for tomorrow. Maybe squeeze in a quick game session before heading home.
